lines.gurmukhi: jYsy KwNf KwNf khY muiK nhI mITw hoie; jb lg jIB sÍwd KwNfu nhIN KweIAY [

Unknown.translation: Just as by saying sugar, sugar, one cannot feel sweet taste of sugar in the mouth. Unless sugar is placed on the tongue, it cannot feel its taste.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ KMf KMf AwKidAwˆ Edoˆ qk mUMh im`Tw nhIˆ hoieAw krdw, jdoˆ qk ik jIB nwl sÍwd lYˆidAwˆ hoieAwˆ KMf nUM KweIey nw[

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy rwq AMDyrI mY dIpk dIpk khY; iqmr n jweI jb lg n jrweIAY [

Unknown.translation: In a dark night, saying lamp, lamp does not dispel darkness unless lamp is lit.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy igAwn igAwn khY igAwn hUM n hoq kCu; jb lgu gur igAwn AMqir n pweIAY [

Unknown.translation: Just by saying Gian (Knowledge) again and again, knowledge cannot be obtained. It can only be acquired by lodging His name in the heart.

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: ijs qrHwˆ igAwn igAwn AwiKAwˆ, jd qk gurU igAwn AMdr hI nw Aw vsy, kuC iksy pRkwr dw igAwn BI nhIˆ ho sikAw krdw[

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur iDAwn khY gur iDAwn hU n pwvq; jb lgu gur drs jwie n smweIAY [542[

Unknown.translation: Similarly just repeatedly asking for a glimpse of True Guru, one cannot acquire contemplation of the True Guru. This is possible only when one engrosses oneself up to the soul in the ardent desire of a glimpse of the True Guru.  (542)

Sant Sampuran Singh.translation: iqsy qrHwˆ gur iDAwn AwKdy AwKdy, jdoˆ qk gurU ky drSn ivc smw hI nw jweIey gurU iDAwn BI pRwpq nhIˆ ho sikAw krdw ]542]
